about.title: Meet Sarah Gerges
paragraphs: I am Sarah Gerges, a bilingual English and Arabic educator who has shaped classrooms across Russia and Egypt for more than six years.
From university lecture halls in Tyumen to online mentorship programs in Alexandria, I translate theory into practical classroom strategies for learners and teachers alike.
My lessons blend intercultural awareness with clear frameworks that help students pass exams, settle abroad, and collaborate globally.
Now I coach teachers to build dynamic lesson plans, solve classroom challenges, and lead with confidence—while supporting learners on their multilingual journeys.
credentials: Master’s degree in Linguistics (Ph.D. in progress)
6+ years teaching students in Russia and Egypt
40% increase in exam pass rates for partner schools
30% growth in student participation through interactive materials

rules.title: Lesson Policy & Learning Agreement
rules.description: Please review our lesson policy covering payments, scheduling, cancellations, attendance, and teacher substitutions.

sections.title: Payments & Scheduling
content: Tuition is paid online through Russian bank cards or approved international services directly in your personal account.
Lessons scheduled for the following day must be paid no later than 21:00 Moscow time; unpaid sessions will be released to other learners.
Maintain a positive balance by paying for several lessons in advance so your reserved timeslot remains protected.

sections.title: Cancellations & Rescheduling
content: Notify your teacher in the study chat with @mention at least 24 hours in advance if you need to adjust your regular schedule.
You may reschedule or cancel up to three lessons per calendar month with two hours’ notice; beyond that, the lesson fee is deducted.
Same-day changes are granted at the teacher’s discretion based on availability and workload.

sections.title: Attendance & Lateness
content: If you are more than 15 minutes late without notice, the session is marked as completed because the teacher remained in the classroom.
When you inform the teacher of a delay within the first 15 minutes, the lesson continues but still ends at the scheduled time.

sections.title: Study Breaks
content: Breaks of up to two weeks keep your balance and timeslot safe when you notify the teacher in the study chat before 21:00 the day prior.
For pauses longer than two weeks, we will offer alternative times when you return because the original slot may be assigned to another learner.
Official public holidays in your country may be observed when you inform us in advance.

sections.title: Teacher Changes
content: If a teacher becomes unavailable due to illness or unforeseen events, we will inform you promptly and offer a suitable replacement when possible.
Repeated cancellations or unpaid balances may result in schedule adjustments so that teachers can support active students.

policy.title: SA Online School — Lesson Policy
policy.intro: These terms explain how we manage payments, scheduling, lesson cancellations, and teacher substitutions so every learner receives consistent support.

sections.title: Payments & Scheduling
content: Lessons are paid online through Russian bank cards or verified international services. Funds typically appear instantly in your personal account.
Sessions planned for the next day must be paid by 21:00 Moscow time. Unpaid lessons are released to other students even if payment arrives later.
Keeping a positive balance signals your intention to continue. We recommend purchasing multiple lessons in advance to secure your preferred schedule.

sections.title: Cancellations & Rescheduling
content: To adjust your regular timetable, message the teacher in the study chat with an @mention at least 24 hours before the affected lesson.
Each student may cancel or reschedule up to three lessons per calendar month for any reason when at least two hours’ notice is provided in the study chat.
If you exceed three adjustments in a month, the cost of each additional missed lesson is deducted from your balance or the slot is reassigned when the balance is zero.

sections.title: Attendance & Lateness
content: When you request a same-day change, the teacher will confirm availability based on their workload and personal plans.

If you do not join within 15 minutes and do not contact the teacher, the lesson is considered completed. Informing the teacher within those 15 minutes keeps the lesson active but it still ends at the original time.

sections.title: Study Breaks
content: Short breaks under two weeks keep your balance and timeslot reserved when you notify the teacher by 21:00 the day before your next lesson.
Breaks longer than two weeks may require a new schedule. Share your return date so we can coordinate with the teacher and reserve a suitable slot.
Classes may be paused during official public holidays in your location when you inform us in advance.

sections.title: Teacher Changes & School Decisions
content: Teachers rarely cancel, but in case of illness or emergencies we will alert you in the study chat and offer an alternative time or teacher if available.
Frequent cancellations or unpaid lessons may lead to a temporary suspension so that the teacher’s schedule remains available for active students.
